children.name: to look for sb/sth when you do not know where they are
look for a1
children.definition: look for/ˈlʊk fɔːʳ/  to try to find something that you have lost, or someone who is not in the place where you expected them to be:
examples: tìm
▪ i’m looking for simon -- have you seen him?
▪ i’ve been looking everywhere for that key! where did you find it?

children.name: try to find a1
children.definition: try to find/ˌtraɪ tə ˈfaɪnd/  to look for someone or something, especially when it is difficult to find them:
examples: cố tìm
▪ jill was up in the attic trying to find her old school books.
▪ i tried to find jack to tell him the news, but he wasn’t anywhere around.

children.name: have a look b1
children.definition: have a look especially spoken to look for sb/sth, especially when you do it quickly or when you only look in one place: tìm kiếm
examples: ▪ ‘i can’t find my shoes.’ ‘have a look in your bedroom.’
have a look for tìm kiếm (cái gì)
▪ i had a look for clive but he wasn’t in his office.
have a quick look xem sơ qua
▪ i’ll just have a quick look for that book before we go.
have a good looklook carefully and thoroughly tìm kiếm kĩ càng
▪ we don’t have time to find it now - we’ll have a good look in the morning.

children.name: search for b2
children.definition: search for to look carefully and thoroughly for someone or something, especially when it is very important that you find them: tìm kiếm
examples: ▪ coastguards are still searching for survivors from the ship.
▪ friends and neighbours joined police officers to search for clues.

children.name: in search of x
children.definition: in search of/ɪn ˈsɜːʳtʃ ɒv/  especially spoken if you goin search ofsomeone or something, you go somewhere in order to find them:
examples: để tìm kiếm
go/set off in search of bắt đầu tìm kiếm
▪ she stayed and talked for a while, then went off in search of flynn.

children.name: hunt b2
children.definition: hunt/hʌnt/  to look urgently and thoroughly for someone or something in every possible place:
examples: ▪ friends and neighbors hunted everywhere, but no-one could find the child.
hunt for
▪ i hunted all morning for the book of photos, but couldn’t find it.

children.name: search b1
children.definition: search/sɜːʳtʃ/  an attempt to find someone or something, especially when this is well organized and a lot of people are doing it:
examples: sự tìm kiếm ( có tổ chức , nhiều người )
search for tìm kiếm
▪ rescuers are continuing their search for survivors of the crash.
▪ their search for gold took them west to washington state.
carry out a search
do a search : tiến hành tìm kiếm
▪ fbi agents carried out a search of all the nightclubs in the area.
search party
an organized group of people searching for someone who is lost :
đội tìm kiếm ( những người đã mất tích )
▪ when the men did not return, the commanding officer sent out a search party.
house-to-house search
when every house in an area is searched : lục soát tìm kiếm từng nhà một
▪ police are carrying out house-to-house searches in villages near the scene of the murder.

children.name: hunt c1
children.definition: hunt/hʌnt/  an organized search by a lot of people, especially to find a criminal:
examples: cuộc săn lùng ( tội phạm )
▪ police have launched a nationwide hunt for the killer.

children.name: wild goose chase x
children.definition: wild goose chase/ˌwaɪld ˈguːs ˌtʃeɪs/  a search that is a waste of time and effort, either because the thing you are looking for does not exist or you have been given wrong information: cuộc đeo đuổi viễn vông
examples: ▪ i had a feeling that the trip up to edinburgh might turn out to be a wild goose chase.
send/take somebody on a wild goose chase khiến ai đó tiến hành một cuộc săn đuổi viễn vông
▪ he lied and took us on a wild goose chase to north yorkshire.

children.name: to look for sth in a bag, box, pocket etc
search b2
children.definition: search/sɜːʳtʃ/  tosearcha person or their clothes to try to find drugs, weapons etc:
examples: lục soát, kiểm tra
be searched bị tìm kiếm
▪ all visitors to the prison are thoroughly searched.
search for tìm kiếm
▪ the men were all searched for weapons and then allowed to enter.

children.name: go through b2
children.definition: go through/ˈgəʊ θruː/  to search someone’s clothes, bags, or possessions very thoroughly: dò soát, lục soát
examples: ▪ customs officials went through his luggage but found nothing.
▪ you have no right to go through my personal possessions!

children.name: rummage x
children.definition: rummage/rummage about/ˈrʌmɪdʒ, ˌrʌmɪdʒ əˈbaʊt/  to look for something among a lot of other things that are all together by moving them around with your hands: lục lọi, tìm tòi
examples: rummage/rummage about in lục lọi trong
▪ louise rummaged in her bag and pulled out a small envelope.
rummage/rummage about for lục tung lên để tìm
▪ he unzipped his school bag and rummaged about for a pencil.

children.name: fish around x
children.definition: fish around/ˌfɪʃ əˈraʊnd/ alsofish about /ˌfɪʃ əˈbaʊt/ british  to look for a small object in a large or deep container, especially using just your hands: mò tìm
examples: fish around in mò tìm trong
▪ sam fished about in his pockets and produced a few coins.
fish around for mò tìm (cái gì)
▪ he fished around in his bag for the letter.

children.name: feel around u
children.definition: feel around/ˌfiːl əˈraʊnd/ alsofeel aboutbritish  to search for something by touch without using your eyes: sờ mò, sờ tìm
examples: ▪ she put her hand under the seat and felt around, but couldn’t find anything.
feel around for sờ tìm (cái gì)
▪ she felt around for the light switch.

children.name: fumble around x
children.definition: fumble around/about/ˌfʌmbəl əˈraʊnd, əˈbaʊt/  to use your hands to look for something in an awkward way, especially because it is dark or you are nervous or in a hurry: lục tung
examples: ▪ the phone rang and, half-asleep, winston fumbled about to find the receiver.
fumble around/about in lục tung trong
▪ he fumbled around in the cupboard, desperately searching for his tablets.
fumble around/about for lục tung tìm
▪ he fumbled around on the ground for his glasses.

children.name: to look for sb/sth that you need or want
look for a1
children.definition: look for to try to find sb/sth that you need: tìm kiếm
examples: can you help me? i’m looking for a place to stay.
the company is looking for young, enthusiastic graduates to work in its sales department.
i spent months looking for a job, with no luck.

children.name: try to find a1
children.definition: try to find/ˌtraɪ tə ˈfaɪnd/  to look for something or someone that you need, especially when it is difficult and takes a long time: cố công tìm kiếm
examples: ▪ i spent half an hour trying to find a parking space.
▪ drug companies are trying to find an alternative drug, which will not have such serious side-effects.

children.name: in search of x
children.definition: in search of/ɪn ˈsɜːʳtʃ ɒv/  especially written if you go in search of something that you need, you go somewhere to try to find it: tìm kiếm
examples: ▪ many young people move to the cities in search of a better future.

children.name: be on the lookout for x
children.definition: be on the lookout for/biː ɒn ðə ˈlʊkaʊt fɔːʳ/  informal to be eagerly and continuously looking for something or someone that might be useful to you: trong công cuộc đi tìm
examples: ▪ my mother’s always on the lookout for a good bargain.
▪ the club is always on the lookout for new young players
.▪ the design department is constantly on the lookout for original ideas.

children.name: search for b1
children.definition: search for/ˈsɜːʳtʃ fɔːʳ/  to spend time trying to find something or someone that you need: tìm kiếm
examples: ▪ i searched everywhere for a birthday present for kim, but i found nothing i liked.
▪ i was made redundant last year, and am still searching for a new job.
▪ the school is currently searching for ways to save money.

children.name: look around for u
children.definition: look around for/ˌlʊk əˈraʊnd fɔːʳ/  to look in different places or directions, in order to find a suitable person or thing that you need: tìm xung quanh
examples: ▪ he looked around for somewhere to hang the wet towel.
▪ we’re always looking around for new products to add to our list.
▪ they’re looking around for a decent apartment, not too far from the city.

children.name: seek b2
children.definition: seek/siːk/  formal to try to get or find something you need, for example advice, friendship, or a job: đi tìm, tìm kiếm
examples: ▪ economics graduate, aged 25, with business experience, seeks interesting part-time work in the west london area.
▪ if you are at all worried about your symptoms, you should seek medical advice.
▪ the government is seeking support from teachers for its latest education reforms.

children.name: hunting b2
children.definition: hunting /ˈhʌntɪŋ/  săn
examples: job/house/bargain etc hunting
when you are trying to find or get a job, house etc:
▪ we rented a car and went house-hunting as soon as we arrived.'
▪ job hunting takes a lot of effort and can be a long, depressing process.

children.name: leave no stone unturned c2
children.definition: leave no stone unturned/ˌliːv nəʊ ˌstəʊn ʌnˈtɜːʳnd/  to do everything that you can to find something such as the answer to a problem - used especially in literature: dùng mọi thủ đoạn, mọi cách
examples: ▪ if a solution can be found, mr danby, i shall leave no stone unturned until i have found it.
▪ union leaders have promised to leave no stone unturned in their search for a way to keep the factory open.

children.name: to look for info in a book, on a computer etc
search b1
children.definition: search/sɜːʳtʃ/  to look for information, a document, an internet page etc on a computer: tìm
examples: ▪ you can search on the internet for the names of dealers in your area.
▪ i searched a few websites, but couldn’t find the information i was looking for.
search[countable noun] cuộc tìm kiếm
▪ i did a quick search on the internet and found three airlines with tickets available on that date.

children.name: look up b1
children.definition: look up/ˌlʊk ˈʌp/  to try to find information by looking in a book, on a list, in computer records: tìm kiém
examples: look up something tìm kiếm cái gì đó
▪ if you look up the title of the book, you should then find the author.
look something up tìm cái gì đó
▪ if you don’t know what it means, look it up in the dictionary.

children.name: go through b2
children.definition: go through/ˈgəʊ θruː/  to carefully examine a piece of writing, a set of documents, an official record etc in order to find a piece of information or check that there are no mistakes: đọc qua (một cách cẩn thận)
examples: ▪ he went through the contract quite carefully, checking all the details
.▪ i’ve finished my essay, but i just need to go through it to check for spelling mistakes.

children.name: trawl x
children.definition: trawl/trawl through/trɔːl, ˈtrɔːl θruː/  to look through a large number of records, documents etc for a particular thing or piece of information: rà soát quá
examples: ▪ she spent hours trawling through patients’ medical records looking for evidence of negligence by doctors.
trawl[countable noun] british: rà soát
▪ a trawl through the jobs pages of his local paper produced only one job that he wanted to apply for.

children.name: scour x
children.definition: scour/skaʊəʳ/  to read a piece of writing or document very carefully in order to find a piece of information that you need: đọc kĩ qua
examples: ▪ he spent half an hour scouring the newspaper for any mention of the fire.

children.name: to search a place to try to find sb/sth
search b1
children.definition: search/sɜːʳtʃ/  tìm kiếm
examples: ▪ at the site, rescue workers have been searching systematically in the hope of finding more survivors.
search a place/area etc tìm kiếm một nơi, khu vục
▪ police have searched the area near his home, but have so far found nothing.
search (a place) for tìm một nơi để kiếm
▪ local people are still searching woods near the victim’s home for any clues to help find her killer.

children.name: scour x
children.definition: scour/skaʊəʳ/  to search an area very carefully and thoroughly, looking for something that is very important: sục sạo, sục tìm
examples: scour a place for sục tìm một nơi để kiếm
▪ a team of detectives is scouring the area for the murder weapon.
▪ developers are scouring the country for possible sites for these new superstores.

children.name: comb x
children.definition: comb/kəʊm/  to thoroughly examine a large area in great detail, especially by moving across it, looking for something or someone that is difficult to find: lục soát
examples: ▪ police and volunteers are combing the countryside in the hope of finding the missing boy.
▪ rescuers combed the hillsides but found no trace of the missing climbers.
comb a place for lục soát một nơi để tìm
▪ the children combed the shoreline for shells.

children.name: drag a river x
children.definition: drag a river/pond etc/ˌdræg ə ˈrɪvəʳ/  to search for something in a river, lake etc by pulling a heavy net along the bottom: vớt tìm
examples: ▪ the murder weapon, a kitchen knife, was found when police dragged a nearby pond.

children.name: ransack x
children.definition: ransack /ˈrænsæk/  to search a room, house, cupboard etc very thoroughly and roughly in order to find things or steal things, usually causing a lot of untidiness or damage: lục soát, tìm khắp
examples: ▪ thieves broke in and ransacked the house.
▪ the newspaper’s offices were ransacked by members of the secret police.

children.name: turn swh inside out x
children.definition: turn somewhere inside out/upside down /ˌtɜːʳn sʌmweəʳ ˌɪnsaɪd ˈaʊt, ˌʌpsaɪd ˈdaʊn/  to search a house, a room etc very thoroughly, often making it very untidy: lật tung (nhà, phòng)
examples: ▪ we turned all the cupboards inside out but couldn’t find the letters.
▪ i turned the house upside down looking for my birth certificate

children.name: keep your eye out for c1
children.definition: keepyour/aneye out forsb/sthinformal
examples: to watch carefully for someone or something to appear
keep your eye out for signposts to yosemite.

children.name: quest c2
children.definition: questnounliterary sự tìm kiếm; sựtruy tìm; sự truy lùng; sự lục soát
examples: a long search for something that is difficult to find, or an attempt to achieve something difficult
_nothing will stop themintheir questfortruth.
_she went to indiaona spiritual quest.
_[ + to infinitive ]she does aerobics four times a week in her questtoachieve the perfect body.
